content.description: The crux is probably the first move or two. The topout could also be hard, because you can’t really see the holds that well, so you pretty much just have to guess (that’s why it’s called Wheel of Fortune).
content.protection: It has a very nice landing for a pad.
content.location: Wheel of Fortune is in the middle of the red green and yellow stripes, on the left side of Rainbow Rocks. You sit start with your hands and feet in the green stripe.

content.description:
The start to this is on the right side of the cliff, in front of a tree. Start on a long wide jug that is angled a little bit to the left. Follow the line of sharp and sloped jugs, straight up.

 *This route is on a whole different rock. It is very close but not connected to the main cliff.
content.protection: There is a bolt at the top and trees farther back for TR. It is very hard to protect with pads. Definitely remember to back up the bolt, as it is kind of sketchy and I don’t know how old it is.
content.location: When you get to the clearing, don’t go up the hill to the main wall. Walk a short way along the trail to the right until you see a tall (not very wide) cliff on the left, it is hard to miss.

content.description: Stairway to Heaven goes up 3 rails to the top of Rainbow Rocks. The crux is the third rail.
content.protection: It has a very nice landing for a pad.
content.location: The climb is to the left of Above the Flag and to the right of Wheel of Fortune. The start is right above the lowest rail on a pinch and the adjacent ledge.

content.description: This is a super fun link-up of some of the routes on this cliff. It starts sitting under the start jug for Weak Cookie and then goes up for a bit and traverses left, joining Armageddon Clock for the finish.
content.protection: TR, use a bolt on top, and back it up with trees, because it is kind of sketchy. Bring many pads if you are bouldering it.
content.location: Sit start on 2 edges about 2 feet below the sharp starting jug of Weak Cookie, and do a big move to that sharp jug. Continue up on good holds, and then traverse left once you have reached some good holds next to the right-angling seam/crack. Then you have a fun, balancy crux sequence, with sidepulls, and a crimp ledge. Then continue straight up on good holds to the top.

content.description: Polymorph  is a long, pumpy route that starts with crimps and edges and then traverses a slopey rail. Then it continues up and right, finishing on the same route as: Above The Flag (5.7, V0).
content.protection: Pads and spotter, one moving pad is fine too.
content.location: Start on the same start holds as Wheel of Fortune on sidepull crimps on the green painted stripe, and traverse right, going across the slopey bottom rail (no using the one above it). Then you can get a good sitting rest, before using the jug ledge above you to go right, and top out similar to Goblin Artillery and Above the Flag.

content.description: This is a super fun and tricky route that ascends a right-angling crack/seam, starting with hard moves on tiny, sharp crimps and sidepulls, and moving into reaches between good holds to the top.
content.protection: TR, use a bolt on top, and back it up with trees, because it is kind of sketchy. Bring many pads if you are bouldering it, there is a tree right behind the top section, so bouldering it would be PG-13 or even R.
content.location: Start on 2 obvious, left-facing sidepulls, and make some hard moves on sharp and painful crimps until you can match a blocky, sidepull thing. Then continue up and right along the crack/seam, using pretty good holds, to the top. (The left angling crack on the left is off.)

content.description: Start on 2 edges (the right one is lower than the left). Go up angling slightly left and to a sloppy ledge, then top out using big edges.
content.location: It is to the far right of the main rock with and just to the left of the green paint. The boulder goes in between some trees. On the right side, there are two trees, and on the left there is one.

content.description: This is a fun long route. The only hard move is the first one, then it is basically all big positive holds to the top. If you fall on the last few moves, you could hurt yourself, so be careful, use many pads, and have a spotter too. The good news is that the top is really easy.
content.protection: Lots of pads and a spotter.
content.location: Start on 2 incut sidepulls on a flake down low (can use a sit start). Make a cross move left to a big sidepull, and then move up on jugs to the top.

content.description: Armageddon Clock is a super fun route with lots of small, sharp, crimpy moves and big reaches in the middle of the overhanging face.*This is on a separate rock than the main cliff. When you get to the clearing, don’t go up the hill to the main wall. Walk a short way along the trail to the right until you see a tall (not very wide) cliff on the left. It is hard to miss.
content.protection: There is a bolt on top and trees for a TR (definitely back up the bolt). This could be bouldered as well - bring many pads if you are.
content.location: Start with your left hand on an incut knob in the left-angling crack and your right hand on a gaston. Go straight up using holds above you as well as using the left-angling crack to your left. The line curves slightly left at the top.

content.description: The crux is getting over the first ledge. You go up a few feet then traverse across a crack to the right, then go up to the topout.
content.protection: Use trees at the top or a lot of pads. I recommend a toprope because of the traverse. It might be hard to protect with pads.
content.location: The start is the spray painted American flag. From there, reach up into the crack on the left.

content.description: This is a fairly large rock with lots of climbs mostly bouldering and some TR.
